item.title: By: bfp
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: For the record - we never did the "aphotoperday" website because only I took photos :(
item.content:encoded: For the record – we never did the “aphotoperday” website because only I took photos üôÅ

item.title: By: karima
item.dc:creator: karima
item.description: Gordon, There is a photo of a family of baby racoons with your New Years" newsletter. What is the location? Karimammma
item.content:encoded:
Gordon,
There is a photo of a family of baby racoons with your New Years” newsletter. What is the location?
Karimammma

item.title: By: karima
item.dc:creator: karima
item.description: I like your photo-a-day idea. You are probably aware of the movie (one of my favories) "SMOKE" where the main character, Augie, takes a photo every day in front on his tobacco shop. Same spot, same time, every day.
item.content:encoded: I like your photo-a-day idea. You are probably aware of the movie (one of my favories) “SMOKE” where the main character, Augie, takes a photo every day in front on his tobacco shop. Same spot, same time, every day.

item.title: By: bluefacedpixie » First Run of the Year
item.dc:creator: bluefacedpixie » First Run of the Year
item.description: [...] It was warm but wet, although in the trees the rain wasn’t so heavy. I ran the loop clockwise from the north carpark once, with a big diversion down to South Beach/lighthouse and then the North Beach. The tide was in so I ran on the trails rather than the beach itself. I stopped to take a couple of bad pictures for a photo per day on the way to the lighthouse, and as soon as I put my camera away an eagle drifted by about 30 feet away. That was kind of special. [...]
item.content:encoded: […] It was warm but wet, although in the trees the rain wasn’t so heavy. I ran the loop clockwise from the north carpark once, with a big diversion down to South Beach/lighthouse and then the North Beach. The tide was in so I ran on the trails rather than the beach itself. I stopped to take a couple of bad pictures for a photo per day on the way to the lighthouse, and as soon as I put my camera away an eagle drifted by about 30 feet away. That was kind of special. […]
